intro: Plagiobothrys tenellus var. colorans, commonly known as the showy bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems with small, oval leaves, and its flowers are clustered in dense, curling inflorescences. This variety is distinguished by its more vibrant floral coloration compared to the typical form of Plagiobothrys tenellus.
